message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.AR, cs.CC

Reasoning: 
1. cs.IT (Information Theory) - The paper proposes a modification of the Index-less Indexed Flash Codes (ILIFC) for flash memory storage system, which involves coding and compression techniques that are commonly studied in information theory.
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The proposed scheme involves the use of layer-based index coding to represent indices of information bits, which is a data structure commonly studied in this sub-category.
3. cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) - Although not directly related to social networks, the paper deals with the optimization of information storage and retrieval, which is a common problem in networked systems.
4. cs.AR (Hardware Architecture) - The paper deals with flash memory storage systems, which are a type of hardware architecture commonly studied in this sub-category.
5. cs.CC (Computational Complexity) - The paper discusses the performance of the proposed scheme in terms of worst case and average case scenarios, which are concepts commonly studied in computational complexity.
